intro: Paederota axillaris, commonly known as the axillary blister beetle, is a species of beetle belonging to the family Scarabaeidae. It is characterized by its distinctive black body with yellow or orange markings, and it is often found in grassy or wooded areas. The larvae of this species are typically found in soil, feeding on decaying plant matter. Paederota axillaris plays a role in nutrient cycling by breaking down organic material. However, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental or medicinal purposes.
